description: This operation returns information about a job you previously initiated, including the job initiation date, the user who initiated the job, the job status code/message and the Amazon SNS topic to notify after Amazon S3 Glacier (Glacier) completes the job. For more information about initiating a job, see  InitiateJob. A job ID will not expire for at least 24 hours after Glacier completes the job. An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). For more information about using this operation, see the documentation for the underlying REST API Describe Job in the Amazon Glacier Developer Guide.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The AccountId value is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single -- -' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens (---') in the ID. Note: this parameter is set to '-' bydefault if no value is not specified.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The ID of the job to describe.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: An opaque string that identifies an Amazon S3 Glacier job.

nested_items.name: JobDescription
nested_items.description: The job description provided when initiating the job.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The job type. This value is either ArchiveRetrieval, InventoryRetrieval, or Select.

nested_items.name: ArchiveId
nested_items.description: The archive ID requested for a select job or archive retrieval. Otherwise, this field is null.

nested_items.name: VaultARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault from which an archive retrieval was requested.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The UTC date when the job was created. This value is a string representation of ISO 8601 date format, for example "2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z".

nested_items.name: Completed
nested_items.description: The job status. When a job is completed, you get the job's output using Get Job Output (GET output).

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The status code can be InProgress, Succeeded, or Failed, and indicates the status of the job.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A friendly message that describes the job status.

nested_items.name: ArchiveSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: For an archive retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the archive being requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or select job, this value is null.

nested_items.name: InventorySizeInBytes
nested_items.description: For an inventory retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the inventory requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select job, this value is null.

nested_items.name: SNSTopic
nested_items.description: An Amazon SNS topic that receives notification.

nested_items.name: CompletionDate
nested_items.description: The UTC time that the job request completed. While the job is in progress, the value is null.

nested_items.name: SHA256TreeHash
nested_items.description: For an archive retrieval job, this value is the checksum of the archive. Otherwise, this value is null.
Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash aligned.
Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole archive, when the job status is InProgress.
Inventory jobs.
Select jobs.

nested_items.name: ArchiveSHA256TreeHash
nested_items.description: The SHA256 tree hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval. For inventory retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.

nested_items.name: RetrievalByteRange
nested_items.description: The retrieved byte range for archive retrieval jobs in the form StartByteValue-EndByteValue. If no range was specified in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this case, StartByteValue equals 0 and EndByteValue equals the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.

nested_items.name: Tier
nested_items.description: The tier to use for a select or an archive retrieval. Valid values are Expedited, Standard, or Bulk. Standard is the default.

nested_items.name: InventoryRetrievalParameters
nested_items.description: Parameters used for range inventory retrieval.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The output format for the vault inventory list, which is set by the InitiateJob request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault inventory. Valid values are CSV and JSON.

nested_items.name: StartDate
nested_items.description: The start of the date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created on or after this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example 2013-03-20T17:03:43Z.

nested_items.name: EndDate
nested_items.description: The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created before this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example 2013-03-20T17:03:43Z.

nested_items.name: Limit
nested_items.description: The maximum number of inventory items returned per vault inventory retrieval request. This limit is set when initiating the job with the a InitiateJob request.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new InitiateJob request to obtain additional inventory items. If there are no more inventory items, this value is null. For more information, see Range Inventory Retrieval.

nested_items.name: JobOutputPath
nested_items.description: Contains the job output location.

nested_items.name: SelectParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the parameters used for a select.

nested_items.name: InputSerialization
nested_items.description: Describes the serialization format of the object.

nested_items.name: FileHeaderInfo
nested_items.description: Describes the first line of input. Valid values are None, Ignore, and Use.

nested_items.name: Comments
nested_items.description: A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when the character is present at the start of that row.

nested_items.name: QuoteEscapeCharacter
nested_items.description: A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character inside an already escaped value.

nested_items.name: RecordDelimiter
nested_items.description: A value used to separate individual records from each other.

nested_items.name: FieldDelimiter
nested_items.description: A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a record.

nested_items.name: QuoteCharacter
nested_items.description: A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part of the value.

nested_items.name: ExpressionType
nested_items.description: The type of the provided expression, for example SQL.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: The expression that is used to select the object.

nested_items.name: OutputSerialization
nested_items.description: Describes how the results of the select job are serialized.

nested_items.name: QuoteFields
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether all output fields should be contained within quotation marks.

nested_items.name: QuoteEscapeCharacter
nested_items.description: A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character inside an already escaped value.

nested_items.name: RecordDelimiter
nested_items.description: A value used to separate individual records from each other.

nested_items.name: FieldDelimiter
nested_items.description: A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a record.

nested_items.name: QuoteCharacter
nested_items.description: A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part of the value.

nested_items.name: OutputLocation
nested_items.description: Contains the location where the data from the select job is stored.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the job results are stored.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The prefix that is prepended to the results for this request.

nested_items.name: Encryption
nested_items.description: Contains information about the encryption used to store the job results in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: EncryptionType
nested_items.description: The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in Amazon S3, for example AES256 or aws:kms.

nested_items.name: KMSKeyId
nested_items.description: The AWS KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT requests for an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.

nested_items.name: KMSContext
nested_items.description: Optional. If the encryption type is aws:kms, you can use this value to specify the encryption context for the job results.

nested_items.name: CannedACL
nested_items.description: The canned access control list (ACL) to apply to the job results.

nested_items.name: AccessControlList
nested_items.description: A list of grants that control access to the staged results.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Type of grantee.

nested_items.name: DisplayName
nested_items.description: Screen name of the grantee.

nested_items.name: URI
nested_items.description: URI of the grantee group.

nested_items.name: ID
nested_items.description: The canonical user ID of the grantee.

nested_items.name: EmailAddress
nested_items.description: Email address of the grantee.

nested_items.name: Permission
nested_items.description: Specifies the permission given to the grantee.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: UserMetadata
nested_items.description: A map of metadata to store with the job results in Amazon S3.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StorageClass
nested_items.description: The storage class used to store the job results.
